reporting_cycle: Secretary-General reports not explicitly mentioned, but Panel of Experts to provide midterm report by 12 November 2012 and final report no later than thirty days prior to the termination of its mandate
summary:
The Security Council, recalling previous relevant resolutions and presidential statements, adopted Resolution 2050 (2012) on June 12, 2012. The Council extended the mandate of the Panel of Experts, established pursuant to resolution 1874 (2009), until July 12, 2013. The Panel's mandate includes providing independent assessments, analysis, and recommendations on the implementation of sanctions imposed by resolutions 1718 (2006) and 1874 (2009).

The Council requested the Panel to provide a midterm report by November 12, 2012, and a final report 30 days prior to the termination of its mandate. The Panel is also required to provide a planned programme of work within 30 days of reappointment and to submit updates to the Committee.

The Council emphasized the importance of credible and fact-based assessments and urged all states, UN bodies, and interested parties to cooperate fully with the Committee and the Panel of Experts. The Council expressed its intent to continue following the work of the Panel and to review the mandate and take appropriate action regarding further extension by June 12, 2013. The Council decided to remain actively seized of the matter.
